descriptions:

Title: A Consolidated Library of Anglo-Saxon Poetry

This project proposes the creation of a comprehensive online library of all surviving Anglo-Saxon verse, spanning the period of c. 670-1100 CE. The library will feature a corpus of approximately 60,000 lines of poetry, equally divided between Old English and Anglo-Latin, drawn from manuscript witnesses. The collection will be marked up using TEI P5 XML, enabling interactive and in-depth analysis of the poetry. A key focus of the project is documenting the influence of named poets, of which there are around 50, as well as tracing potential influence in anonymous verse. The digital resource will also include sound-files and image-files to enhance user engagement.

The project will foster collaboration and knowledge exchange through conferences, workshops, and a series of publications showcasing the comprehensive multilingual corpus. By providing a consolidated and interactive platform for Anglo-Saxon poetry, this project will have a significant research impact across Europe, shedding new light on the coexistence of Latin and the vernacular in a Christian context. The library will serve as a valuable resource for scholars, students, and enthusiasts alike, promoting a deeper understanding of Anglo-Saxon literature and its cultural significance. By supporting this project, you will be contributing to a major advancement in the field of Anglo-Saxon studies, with far-reaching benefits for research, education, and cultural heritage.
